sentences.sContent: There is a female vice premier, she add colour to our dais today.
sentences.sContent_eng: There is a female vice premier, she add colour to our dais today.
sentences.sCn: 其中有一位女性副总理，她为我们今天的讲台增加了一点鲜艳的色彩。

sentences.sContent: The Doll Festival, which takes place on March 3, features dolls representing an emperor and empress along with their attendants on a tiered dais.
sentences.sContent_eng: The Doll Festival, which takes place on March 3, features dolls representing an emperor and empress along with their attendants on a tiered dais.
sentences.sCn: 3月3日举行的女儿节，玩偶的特点是代表天皇和皇后，以及在分层讲台上的服务员。

sentences.sContent: Though usually more modest versions are put up in homes, in such places as stores, schools and museums, dolls are displayed on a large tiered, red dais .
sentences.sContent_eng: Though usually more modest versions are put up in homes, in such places as stores, schools and museums, dolls are displayed on a large tiered, red dais .
sentences.sCn: 虽然不少家庭通常都有比较温和的版本，但是在商店，学校和博物馆等场所，玩偶在红色的讲台上一层又一层地显示出来。

remMethod.val: 老师几乎天天 (days) 上讲台 (dais)

trans.tranOther: a low stage in a room that you stand on when you are making a speech or performing, so that people can see and hear you
